titleStmt.title: The glory of these nations, or, King and peoples happinesse, being a brief relation of King Charles's royall progresse from Dover to London, how the Lord Generall and the Lord Mayor with all the nobility and Gentrey of the land, brought him thorow the famous city of London to his pallace at Westminster the 29. of May last, being his Majesties birth-day, to the great comfort of his loyall subjects. The tune is, when the King enjoys his own again.
Glory of these nations.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Charles Tyus on London Bridged by Samuel Woomock bookseller in Burry,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original at the British Library.
